txt1: The text below is about the churn rate prevention process. It begins when you record basic details.  When recording basic details is completed, determining ways to increase value needs to be done.  After determining ways to increase value, the next tasks should be recording if they are willing to talk, recording whether or not the customer responded and confirming call date and time, they should be done in parallel.  When recording whether or not the customer responded is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: giving them a call, sending them an email.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they want to leave, asking open-ended questions.  Then, describing your ideas to increase value should be done.  Once describing your ideas to increase value occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: thanking them for their time and feedback, recording the customer’s decision.  Afterwards, asking if they have any other concerns needs to be done.  When asking if they have any other concerns is completed, sending learnings to appropriate managers needs to be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The text below is about the churn rate prevention process - it begins when basic details are recorded. Once the basic details were documented, ways to increase the value must be determined. After determining ways to increase the value, the next tasks should be recording if they are willing to talk, recording whether or not the customer responded and confirming the call date and time, they should be done in parallel. When recording whether or not the customer replied is complete, one or more of the following paths should be executed: giving them a call, sending them an email. Once all pre-tasks are executed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they want to leave, asking open-ended questions. Then, describing your ideas should be done to grow value. Once describing your ideas to increase value happens, one or more of the following paths should be executed: thanking them for their time and feedback, and recording the customer’s decision. As a response, it needs to be asked if they have any other concerns. When the questioning whether they have any other concerns is completed, learnings should be sent to appropriate managers. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the churn rate prevention process. It begins when you record basic details.  Once recording basic details occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: analyzing how they use your product, identifying key points of value.  After identifying key points of value, the next tasks should be determining ways to increase value and quantifying the impact of cancellation, they should be done in parallel.  After that, recording if they are willing to talk needs to be done.  After recording if they are willing to talk, asking open-ended questions needs to be done.  Once asking open-ended questions occurs, describing your ideas to increase value needs to be done.  When describing your ideas to increase value is completed, recording the customer’s decision needs to be done.  Once recording the customer’s decision occurs, asking if they have any other concerns should be done.  When asking if they have any other concerns is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: noting down important learnings from the conversation, sending learnings to appropriate managers.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the control of the failure rate, which starts when you register the basic details. The process is now completed.

After sending them an email, the next tasks should be verifying the call date and time and recording whether or not the customer responded, this should be done in parallel. The next tasks should then be asking open-ended questions and identifying the root cause(s) of the problem. Afterwards, they should be done in parallel. Once all pre-tasks are executed, inform them of key metrics demonstrating value must be done. After informing them of key metrics demonstrating value, recording of the customer decision needs to be done. You should then ask if they have any other concerns after capturing the customer’s decision. When ask if they have other concerns is completed, learnings should be sent to appropriate managers. Now the process is completed.

After assessing the impact of cancellation, one or more of the following paths should be executed: recording whether or not the customer responded to calls, confirming call date and time Once confirming call date and time occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: sending them an email, recording if they are willing to talk. Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they are to leave, identifying the root cause(s) of the problem and asking open-ended questions. Afterwards, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: informing them of key metrics demonstrating value and describing your ideas to increase value. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed : recording the customer’s decision, thanking them for their time and feedback. Then the question should be asked if they have any other concerns. After asking if they have any other concerns, one or more of the following paths should be performed : sending learnings to appropriate managers, noting important learnings from the conversation. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the churn rate prevention process. It begins when you record basic details.  Once recording basic details occurs, identifying key points of value needs to be done.  Once identifying key points of value occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: recording whether or not the customer responded, sending them an email.  After sending them an email, you need to confirm call date and time. Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, summarizing why they want to leave.  Once summarizing why they want to leave occurs, asking open-ended questions should be done.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: presenting them with a special offer, describing your ideas to increase value.  When presenting them with a special offer is completed, informing them of key metrics demonstrating value should be done.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: thanking them for their time and feedback, recording the customer’s decision.  Afterwards, you need to ask if they have any other concerns. Once asking if they have any other concerns occurs, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: sending learnings to appropriate managers and noting down important learnings from the conversation.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the reduction of the churn rate. It begins when you record basic details. Once basic details are recorded, identifying the key points of value needs to be done. Once identifying the key points of value occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed : recording whether or not the customer responded or not, sending them an email. After sending them an email, you need to confirm the date and time of your call. Then one or more of the following paths should be executed: identifying the root cause(s) of the problem and summarizing why they want to leave. Once there is a summary of why they want to leave, the questions should be open ended. Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed : presenting them with a special offer, describing your ideas to increase value. When a special offer is given to the participants, informing them of key metrics demonstrating value should be done. One or more of the following paths should be followed : thanking them for their time and feedback, and recording the customer’s decision. Afterwards, you need to ask if you have any other concerns. Once asked if they have any other concerns, the process is split into 2 parallel branches : sending learnings to appropriate managers and noting important learnings from the conversation. The process is now completed.

Then, asking if they have any other concerns should be done.  When asking if they have any other concerns is completed, the next tasks should be noting down important learnings from the conversation and sending learnings to appropriate managers, they should be done in parallel.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the churn rate prevention process. It starts with recording basic details.  When recording basic details is completed, you need to quantify the impact of cancellation. After quantifying the impact of cancellation, one or more of the following paths should be executed: sending them an email, giving them a call.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they want to leave, asking open-ended questions, identifying the root cause(s) of the problem.  After that, the next tasks should be presenting them with a special offer and describing your ideas to increase value, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then thanking them for their time and feedback needs to be done.  After thanking them for their time and feedback, you need to ask if they have any other concerns. Once asking if they have any other concerns occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: sending learnings to appropriate managers, noting down important learnings from the conversation.  The process is now completed.

The process is now concluded.

Once recording basic details occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: identifying key points of value, quantifying the impact of cancellation.  When identifying key points of value is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: determining ways to increase value, analyzing how they use your product.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: confirming call date and time, recording whether or not the customer responded.  After recording whether or not the customer responded, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: giving them a call and sending them an email.  Then, the next tasks should be identifying the root cause(s) of the problem and asking open-ended questions, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then describing your ideas to increase value should be done.  After describing your ideas to increase value, the next tasks should be recording the customer’s decision and thanking them for their time and feedback, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then asking if they have any other concerns needs to be done.  When asking if they have any other concerns is completed, the next tasks should be sending learnings to appropriate managers and noting down important learnings from the conversation, they should be done in parallel.  The process is now completed.

Once determining ways to increase value occurs, quantifying the impact of cancellation should be done.  After that, the next tasks should be sending them an email and recording if they are willing to talk, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then identifying the root cause(s) of the problem needs to be done.  After identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, informing them of key metrics demonstrating value needs to be done.  After informing them of key metrics demonstrating value, thanking them for their time and feedback needs to be done.  Once thanking them for their time and feedback occurs, you need to ask if they have any other concerns. After asking if they have any other concerns, you need to note down important learnings from the conversation. The process is now completed.

After identifying the root cause of the problem, it needs to inform the person of key metrics demonstrating value. After bringing them forward with key metrics to demonstrate value, it needs to thank them for their time and feedback. Once you thank them for their time and feedback, it is necessary to ask if they have any other concerns. After asking if they have other concerns, you need to note important lessons from the conversation. The process is now completed.

txt1: The text below is about the churn rate prevention process. It begins when you record basic details.  When recording basic details is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: quantifying the impact of cancellation, analyzing how they use your product.  Afterwards, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: recording whether or not the customer responded and giving them a call.  Once giving them a call occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: confirming call date and time, recording if they are willing to talk, sending them an email.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, asking open-ended questions.  Afterwards, the next tasks should be informing them of key metrics demonstrating value and presenting them with a special offer, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the next tasks should be thanking them for their time and feedback and recording the customer’s decision, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then asking if they have any other concerns needs to be done.  After asking if they have any other concerns, you need to send learnings to appropriate managers. The process is now completed.

The next tasks should be informing them of key metrics demonstrating value and presenting them with a special offer ; this should be done in parallel. Once all pre-tasks are executed then the next tasks should be thanking them for their time and feedback and recording the customer’s decision in parallel. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the question needs to be asked whether they have any other concerns. After asking if they have any other concerns, you need to send learnings to the correct managers. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the churn rate prevention process. It starts with recording basic details.  After recording basic details, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: identifying key points of value and determining ways to increase value.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the next tasks should be recording if they are willing to talk and giving them a call, they should be done in parallel.  When recording if they are willing to talk is completed, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: sending them an email and confirming call date and time.  After sending them an email, recording whether or not the customer responded needs to be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they want to leave, identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, asking open-ended questions.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: informing them of key metrics demonstrating value, presenting them with a special offer.  Afterwards, thanking them for their time and feedback should be done.  When thanking them for their time and feedback is completed, asking if they have any other concerns needs to be done.  When asking if they have any other concerns is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: noting down important learnings from the conversation, sending learnings to appropriate managers.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the churn rate prevention process, which starts with recording basic details. After recording the basic details, the process is split into 2 parallel branches : identification of key points of value and making the right steps to increase value. After all pre-tasks are executed, the next tasks should be recording if they are willing to talk and give them a call - they should be performed in parallel. When the recording is complete and the two branches are split into two parallel branches: sending them an email and confirming the call date and time. After they have sent them an email, recording needs to be done to determine whether or not the customer responded. Once all the pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: summarizing why they want to leave, identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, and asking open-ended questions. Afterwards one or more of the following paths are to be executed: informing them of the key metrics that illustrate value, and presenting them with a special offer. Next, thanking them for their time and feedback should be done. When thanking for their time and feedback is completed, if they have any other concerns that need to be addressed. When asking if they have other concerns is completed, one or more of the following should be executed: noting important learnings from the conversation and sending learnings to appropriate managers. The process is now complete.

These should be done in parallel. Once all Pretasks are completed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: confirming the date and time of the call and enabling them to call. Then there must be a summarizing why they want to leave. After expressing why they want to leave, describing your ideas to increase the value needs to be done. After describing your ideas to increase value, one or more of the following paths should be performed: Recording the customer's decision and thanking them for their time and feedback. Next, someone needs to ask if they have other concerns. If the question takes place if they have any other concerns then one or more of the following paths should be executed: - Sending learnings to appropriate managers, noting important learnings from the conversation. The process is completed now.

When recording if they are willing to talk is completed, identifying the root cause(s) of the problem should be done.  After identifying the root cause(s) of the problem, you need to present them with a special offer. When presenting them with a special offer is completed, you need to record the customer’s decision. After asking if they have any other concerns, you need to note down important learnings from the conversation. The process is now completed.
